Most people don't know about this gem but I can tell you why with all these tags multiplayer,wwii,first person it's a great game developed using source and most pcs can run it relatively well it also has plenty of players throw for how long with the ever waited day of Infamy on its way if you're a history buff you may like this game you may not but their are a few downfalls such as the limits on classes sure it sounds good on paper but it can be bad if someone hogs the class up all day and the source has even less guns than the other version but it has in my opinion better graphics to end on a light note I recommend this game.

Do you like an online gameing experience with a respectful, laid back community, a classic feel, fair deaths, and satisfying kills? This is your game. Good with bolt action rifles? There will always be a place for you on Day of Defeat Source. This game is for accurate shooters more than aggressive shooters. Pushing gets you sniped. Sniping yeilds results. If your favorite kind of weapon is a submachine gun, you will find this game frustrating. If your favorite weapon is a battle rifle, you will love this.
good game but alot of grenade spam

This game is near dead and I can see why. The servers that are left are shitty ones that play only 1 map 24/7, or they are the stupid gun game ones where the map is something out of fucking tron. The few servers that are frequently populated are fun until you get into the same old grind. The way the game goes is that there are 5 flags. Each team spawns and they charge to capture the middle. once a team has the middle they simply camp by setting up mg bipods and snipers. The riflemen run around throwing grenades as fast as they can into the enemy spawn. As the one being trapped in the spawn, you are most likely killed when you stupidly poke your head out to fire by a sniper or mg, or by a grenade as you make the short trek to the fight. There is very little fighting in the sense of one player hunting down a sniper or two soldiers going at eachother. Probably 90% of the kills ever made in this game were with grenades. The only way to get a kill without being riddled by an mg is to bounce a grenade off a wall and hope some dumb bastard steps on it. Overall this game is dying, but not dead. Like the original Day of Defeat which I also have, There will probably be players 10 years from now still playing the same map 24/7, having hundreds of hours played and millions of grenades thrown. I don't enjoy any game that does the 24/7 one map setup because I find that veteran players know everything there is to know about a map and will completely own a noob who dares to buy a game and tries to have fun in what they thought was a cool ww2 shooter. I would avoid this game unless it's on sale. I have played maybe 7 hours and I doubt I'll be playing much more. Stay away from this game and the original if you have a temper becuase if you get banned from one of the few servers left, you will not be enjoying your game much longer either.
This game never goes boring. You got so many choices, so many different opportunities and so much fun!

i love the source engine and i love games based on 2. world war.

This is a great shooter game, basically this is the intense gameplay of counter strike in WW2 setting, great maps, and the best part are the classes to choose from, each with a different set of weapons and items, though the A.I Bots are pretty bad, they can't even shoot you, they just mindlessly walk around the map, hey you can use them as dummy targets for practice hahaha but I'm still hoping they would add smart bots like in cs source, but I heard you can download and install an A.I script to add smart bots, sadly, I never got them to work. However, there are WORKING AND SMART BOTS in some of the multiplayer servers that you can join, they are very fun to play with, plus the multiplayer is really the primary part of the game. It's really really great! I love it! :)

team fortress 2 on war

10/10

Plusy:
+ silnik Source,
+ płynna i dynamiczna rozrywka,
+ możliwość wyboru klas,
+ różne tryby rozrywki,
+ kultura na serwerach,
+ śladowa ilość hackerów,
+ klimatyczna rozrywka.

Minusy:
- mała ilość serwerów (ok 300 z czego połowa opuszczonych).



Z ręką na sercu mogę polecić tę grę osobą które lubią klimaty WW2 oraz rozrywkę w stylu Counter Strike. 
CS, jak i DoD zostały stworzone za pomocą silnika Source. Jednak osoby które są przyzwyczajone do CS-a mogą mieć pewien problem z "fizyką" strzelania. W CS-ie po strzale broń "powraca" do poprzedniej pozycji dzięki czemu nie musimy ruszać praktycznie myszą by strzelać do celu, natomiast w DoD po każdym oddanym strzale odrzut powoduje "ucieczkę" bezpowrotną broni i należy nauczyć się korygowania odrzutu w broni. Podsumowując - jest to czynnik który jest jak najbardziej do nauczenia choć z początku może sprawiać pewne problemy.
Jeśli chodzi o wady oraz zalety tej gry to mógłbym o jej plusach pisać na prawdę wiele. Natomiast minusem jedynym dla mnie jest niewielka ilość serwerów. O Polskich serwerach już nie wspominając gdyż takowych nie ma. Są one co prawda fizycznie na liście ale nikt ich nie odwiedza. Mam taką nadzieję że gra ta nie umrze a Polacy zjednoczą się i zaczną grywać na naszych serwerach.

Que lastima que no se pueden revender los juegos, ahora mismo estoy con muchas ganas de tener mis U$1.87 de vuelta, aunque no me alcance para nada, esto no vale ni un centimo.

Je ne suis pas du genre à donner mes avis sur les jeux que j'achète, mais là il faut bien !

J'ai grandi pendant plus de 5 ans avec le jeu Day of Defeat original, et j'ai donc décidé de profiter des soldes pour m'acheter sa suite DoD:Source. Et franchement, pas de regret, il mérite un petit 18/20 !
De très bons graphismes pour un jeu de cette époque, un jeu fluide, sans aucun doute le meilleur jeu multi sur la 2ème guerre mondiale !

Il y a quelques changements par rapport au premier DoD :
- Moins de classes d'unités, même si au début ça m'a déplu, c'est finalement mieux car les classes sont mieux équilibrées, comme la classe bazooka qui a un fusil en 2ème arme
- Des petites nouveautés sympas, comme le lance-grenade du fusiller, le bar qui peut tirer balle par balle ou en continu, ou la grenade fumigène
- Des éléments dynamiques dans le décor (par exemple des chaises peuvent voler lors d'explosion)

Le seul petit hic (parce qu'il faut bien trouver un truc à dire), c'est d'avoir supprimer le couteau au soldat avec la mitraillette, ou encore le bar qui n'a pas d'arme à feu en arme secondaire. Ca aurait été bien que toutes les classes disposent d'un couteau et d'un revolver comme dans le DoD original.

Un jeu qui va m'occuper pour de longs moins, j'espère que la communauté y est encore active.

This game is great. It mixes the snappy precise gunplay of it's cousin CS Source, mixes in some elements of classes and gametypes akin to Team Fortress, and throws it into a gritty WW2 setting as a cherry on top. This makes for a very fun, challenging, but rewarding experience for those who are willing to learn the mechanics and can think on their feet. Quite easy to hop into, but hard to master. DoD Source really sticks out in the WW2 FPS sub-genre even today.

 It really has that unique Valve touch to it, and it's yet to be recreated in the modern age. Commanding a small yet dedicated playerbase to this day. You can still find quite a few populated NA servers as long as you aren't playing late at night. And once you get into a full 32 player server, it's amazing. That nice chill feeling of enjoying the game and chatting it up with the regulars, busting eachothers' chops for fun, it's something that you will not find today.

Just give it a try. The game is cheap, and I  promise you won't be disappointed. While you're at it, play on the 6th MRB pub server, tell them PepsiMax sent you. ;)

ALLORA.
A quanto pare sono l'unico italiano che conosce questo gioco.
Ma non ci perdiamo in dettagli.
Day of Defeat: Source è un gioco sparatutto in prima persona con tema principale la Seconda Guerra Mondiale,
il gioco è stato creato dalla Valve, cosa molto strana dato che la Valve non ha mai toccato temi come la Seconda Guerra Mondiale. Questo è perchè esistono tanti altri giochi che si basano su questo tema, come Call of Duty: World at War e
Battlefield 1 ,anche se ambientato nella prima. Questo è il perchè questo gioco non ha avuto tanta fama, sia dai fan della Valve, sia da altri videogiocatori. Avendo un motore grafico onesto, cioè nè troppo scarso e nè troppo potente, riesce sempre a realizzare un'atmosfera ben riuscita. Ma come ogni gioco ha dei suoi Pro e dei suoi Contro.

PRO:
-Atmosfera ben riuscita.
-Mappe create dalla community che ampliano sempre di più il gioco.
-Server con delle Gamemode uniche.
-Giocatori onesti, ovvero pochi cheater, bug abuser ecc...
-Skin scaricabili online.
-Ha la lingua italiana.
-Partite On-Line veramente avvincenti.
-I giocatori hanno un cervello.
-Una Community ATTIVA.

CONTRO:
-Poche classi: Fuciliere; Supporto; Cecchino; Assalto; Mitragliatore; Bazooka.
-Solo una modalità di gioco vanilla: Cattura i punti di controllo avversari.
-Armi ristrette.
-Avvolte capita di incontrare giocatori inattivi.
-I servers di gioco sono divisi in quattro parti: Server pieni di giocatori bravi; Servers pieni di giocatori nuovi; Servers con i     bot; Servers vuoti.
-L'1% sono giocatori italiani.

Voto finale: 8/10
